capsules_submitted.utterance: So Neville has some belongings that are actually a toad. I'm quite certain about this, and I have to say, it's kind of surprising. The sentiment here is one of mild amusement, but also a hint of concern for the well-being of the toad.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just talking to Harry and he's looking a bit flushed. He has that red hair, you know? It really stands out when he's upset or excited. Anyway, I'm pretty sure what I saw - it looked like his cheeks were getting all pink.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Hermione is 11 years old. I'm pretty sure about that, and it's a fact that's definitely true.
Hermione is only 11 years old, I know she's a brilliant witch and all, but that's still pretty young for someone who's already making such a big impact in the wizarding world.
capsules_submitted.reply: let me ask you something. valeria is eleven years old.

capsules_submitted.utterance: Harry's belongings are indeed a gray mouse. I'm quite certain about that, and it sounds like a pretty ordinary thing to me. It doesn't seem particularly exciting or noteworthy, but I suppose it's just one of those things that exists in the world.

You know, I've been thinking about Harry and his belongings. It's interesting that he has a gray mouse as one of them. I'd say the certainty on this fact is pretty high, it's not something you can easily forget or misremember. As for the polarity, I'd rate it as somewhat neutral, it's just an observation about someone else's stuff. The sentiment towards Harry having a gray mouse isn't really strong either way, it's just a curious thing to note. But if I had to pick an emotion, I'd say there's a hint of amusement or mild surprise at the idea of someone owning such an unusual item.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what kind of person is gray mouse?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think McGonagall's glasses are really cool. I mean, who wouldn't want to wear a pair of magical square lenses that can see through all sorts of spells and potions? It's just so... impressive.
